gospel.text:
[[Jn 10,1]]Jesus said:  "Amen, amen, I say to you,  whoever does not enter a sheepfold through the gate  but climbs over elsewhere is a thief and a robber.
[[Jn 10,2]]But whoever enters through the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.
[[Jn 10,3]]The gatekeeper opens it for him, and the sheep hear his voice, as he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
[[Jn 10,4]]When he has driven out all his own, he walks ahead of them, and the sheep follow him, because they recognize his voice.
[[Jn 10,5]]But they will not follow a stranger; they will run away from him, because they do not recognize the voice of strangers."
[[Jn 10,6]]Although Jesus used this figure of speech, they did not realize what he was trying to tell them.
[[Jn 10,7]]So Jesus said again, "Amen, amen, I say to you, I am the gate for the sheep.
[[Jn 10,8]]All who came (before me) are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.
[[Jn 10,9]]I am the gate. Whoever enters through me will be saved, and will come in and go out and find pasture.
[[Jn 10,10]]A thief comes only to steal and slaughter and destroy; I came so that they might have life and have it more abundantly."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John

first_reading.text:
[[Ac 11,1]]The Apostles and the brothers who were in Judea  heard that the Gentiles too had accepted the word of God.
[[Ac 11,2]]So when Peter went up to Jerusalem the circumcised believers confronted him,
[[Ac 11,3]]saying, "You entered the house of uncircumcised people and ate with them."
[[Ac 11,4]]Peter began and explained it to them step by step, saying,
[[Ac 11,5]]"I was at prayer in the city of Joppa when in a trance I had a vision, something resembling a large sheet coming down, lowered from the sky by its four corners, and it came to me.
[[Ac 11,6]]Looking intently into it, I observed and saw the four-legged animals of the earth, the wild beasts, the reptiles, and the birds of the sky.
[[Ac 11,7]]I also heard a voice say to me, 'Get up, Peter. Slaughter and eat.'
[[Ac 11,8]]But I said, 'Certainly not, sir, because nothing profane or unclean has ever entered my mouth.'
[[Ac 11,9]]But a second time a voice from heaven answered, 'What God has made clean, you are not to call profane.'
[[Ac 11,10]]This happened three times, and then everything was drawn up again into the sky.
[[Ac 11,11]]Just then three men appeared at the house where we were, who had been sent to me from Caesarea.
[[Ac 11,12]]The Spirit told me to accompany them without discriminating. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man's house.
[[Ac 11,13]]He related to us how he had seen (the) angel standing in his house, saying, 'Send someone to Joppa and summon Simon, who is called Peter,
[[Ac 11,14]]who will speak words to you by which you and all your household will be saved.'
[[Ac 11,15]]As I began to speak, the holy Spirit fell upon them as it had upon us at the beginning,
[[Ac 11,16]]and I remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said, 'John baptized with water but you will be baptized with the holy Spirit.'
[[Ac 11,17]]If then God gave them the same gift he gave to us when we came to believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to be able to hinder God?"
[[Ac 11,18]]When they heard this, they stopped objecting and glorified God, saying, "God has then granted life-giving repentance to the Gentiles too."
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles

psalm.text:
[[Ps 42,2]]As the hind longs for the running waters, 
so my soul longs for you, O God.
[[Ps 42,3]]Athirst is my soul for God, the living God. 
When shall I go and behold the face of God?

[[Ps 43,3]]Send forth your light and your fidelity; 
they shall lead me on 
And bring me to your holy mountain, 
to your dwelling place.

[[Ps 43,4]]Then will I go in to the altar of God, 
the God of my gladness and joy; 
Then will I give you thanks upon the harp, 
O God, my God!
psalm.title: Psalms
